bugs.title: CVE-2014-8354 ImageMagick: out-of-bounds memory access in resize code

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2014-8354 ImageMagick: out-of-bounds memory access in resize code

long_desc.thetext:
ImageMagick 6.8.9-9 fixes an unspecified bug in image resize code.
It's likely [1] that this is pretty low-impact issue.

[1]: https://bugs.gentoo.org/show_bug.cgi?id=527028#c0

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1158520]
ImageMagick-6.8.8.10-9.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2014-8354 ImageMagick: out-of-bounds memory access in resize code [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2014-8354 ImageMagick: out-of-bounds memory access in resize code

long_desc.thetext:
ImageMagick 6.8.9-9 fixes an unspecified bug in image resize code.
It's likely [1] that this is pretty low-impact issue.

[1]: https://bugs.gentoo.org/show_bug.cgi?id=527028#c0

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1158520]

This seems to be upstream fix, needs to be looked into more and fixed


http://trac.imagemagick.org/changeset/16436#file0

Siddharth Sharma, according to https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2014-8354 it is about resize code. Debian bug (https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-8354) mention http://trac.imagemagick.org/changeset/16765 as fix. It seems more correct for me.

bugs.title: ImageMagick: denial of service flaw in HDR file processing

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-8900 ImageMagick: denial of service flaw in HDR file processing

long_desc.thetext:
A denial of service flaw (infinite loop) was found in the way ImageMagick processed certain HDR files:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2015/q1/608

Upstream issue, including a reproducer:

http://www.imagemagick.org/discourse-server/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=26929

Upstream patches:

http://trac.imagemagick.org/changeset/17845
http://trac.imagemagick.org/changeset/17846

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1195263]
ImageMagick-6.8.8.10-9.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2016/q2/481

Upstream fix:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/97aa7d7cfd2027f6ba7ce42caf8b798541b9cdc6

bugs.title: ImageMagick: denial of service flaw in MIFF file processing

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-8901 ImageMagick: denial of service flaw in MIFF file processing

long_desc.thetext:
A denial of service flaw (infinite loop) was found in the way ImageMagick processed certain MIFF files:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2015/q1/608

Upstream issue, including a reproducer:

http://www.imagemagick.org/discourse-server/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=26931

A patch is not yet available as noted in comment 2 of the above-linked issue.

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1195267]
A patch for this issue should be available for IM6 here: http://trac.imagemagick.org/changeset/17854
ImageMagick-6.8.8.10-9.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2016/q2/481

A patch is not yet available as noted in comment 2 of the above-linked issue.

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1195274]
A patch should be available for IM6 in http://trac.imagemagick.org/changeset/17856
ImageMagick-6.8.8.10-9.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2016/q2/481

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

[bug automatically created by: add-tracking-bugs]

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi update submission link instead:
